001package org.jfree.chart.plot;
002
003
004import org.jfree.chart.internal.Args;
005import java.io.Serializable;
006
007public class SpiderWebPlotProduct implements Serializable, Cloneable {
008        private double headPercent;
009        private double interiorGap;
010
011        public double getHeadPercent() {
012                return headPercent;
013        }
014
015        public void setHeadPercent2(double headPercent) {
016                this.headPercent = headPercent;
017        }
018
019        public double getInteriorGap() {
020                return interiorGap;
021        }
022
023        public void setInteriorGap2(double interiorGap) {
024                this.interiorGap = interiorGap;
025        }
026
027        /**
028        * Sets the head percent and sends a  {@link PlotChangeEvent}  to all registered listeners.  Note that 0.10 is 10 percent.
029        * @param percent   the percent (must be greater than zero).
030        * @see #getHeadPercent()
031        */
032        public void setHeadPercent(double percent, SpiderWebPlot spiderWebPlot) {
033                Args.requireNonNegative(percent, "percent");
034                this.headPercent = percent;
035                spiderWebPlot.fireChangeEvent();
036        }
037
038        /**
039        * Sets the interior gap and sends a  {@link PlotChangeEvent}  to all registered listeners. This controls the space between the edges of the plot and the plot area itself (the region where the axis labels appear).
040        * @param percent   the gap (as a percentage of the available drawing space).
041        * @see #getInteriorGap()
042        */
043        public void setInteriorGap(double percent, SpiderWebPlot spiderWebPlot) {
044                if ((percent < 0.0) || (percent > SpiderWebPlot.MAX_INTERIOR_GAP)) {
045                        throw new IllegalArgumentException("Percentage outside valid range.");
046                }
047                if (this.interiorGap != percent) {
048                        this.interiorGap = percent;
049                        spiderWebPlot.fireChangeEvent();
050                }
051        }
052
053        public Object clone() throws CloneNotSupportedException {
054                return (SpiderWebPlotProduct) super.clone();
055        }
056}
